data.title: Dallas-Fort Worth under heat advisory through Thursday
data.meta_description: The National Weather Service’s Fort Worth office has issued a heat advisory for North and Central Texas through Thursday as temperatures are forecast to reach...
data.text:
The National Weather Service’s Fort Worth office has issued a heat advisory for North and Central Texas through Thursday evening as temperatures are forecast to reach as high as 104 degrees in the Dallas area.

Temperatures are rising after being in the low-to-mid 90s in late July. The coming high temperatures are expected to set new high marks for the year. The previous highest temperature was Friday with a high of 102, according to the Weather Service.

Temperatures in Dallas are forecast to hit 103 on Wednesday and on Thursday, with temperatures in Fort Worth expected to be slightly hotter at 104 for Wednesday and 105 for Thursday, according to the Weather Service. A heat advisory is in effect until 9 p.m. Thursday, as heat indexes in Dallas are expected to hit 106 on Wednesday and 108 on Thursday.

Friday will see a slight dip in the heat, but triple digits are still expected. The forecast for Dallas is a high of 101 with heat indexes as high as 105.

The weather service is advising area residents to drink plenty of water and avoid spending prolonged time outside. The service also said to wear light-colored and lightweight clothing.

Triple-digit heat and high heat indexes are also expected next week, the weather service said.
